skewer.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a long metal or wooden stick that is put through pieces of meat to hold them together while they are cooked
skewer.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make a hole through a piece of food, an object etc with a skewer or with some other pointed object
skewer.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to criticize someone very strongly, often in a way that other people find humorous
skewer.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Du Bois skewered Washington’s policies in his book, ‘The Souls of Black Folks’.
